verses.verse: Better<WH2896> is a dry<WH2720> morsel<WH6595>, and quietness<WH7962> with it<WH1004>, than a house full<WH4392> of feasting<WH2077> with strife<WH7379>.
A wise<WH7919> servant<WH5650> shall have rule<WH4910> over a son<WH1121> that causes shame<WH954>, and shall have part<WH2505> of the inheritance<WH5159> among<WH8432> the brothers<WH251>.
The refining pot<WH4715> is for silver<WH3701>, and the furnace<WH3564> for gold<WH2091>: but the Lord<WH3068> tries<WH974> the hearts<WH3826>.
A wicked doer<WH7489> gives care<WH7181> to false<WH205> lips<WH8193>; and a liar<WH8267> gives ear<WH238> to a naughty<WH1942> tongue<WH3956>.
Whoever mocks<WH3932> the poor<WH7326> blasphemes<WH2778> his Maker<WH6213>: and he that is glad<WH8056> at calamities<WH343> shall not be unpunished<WH5352>.
Children<WH1121>'s sons<WH1121> are the crown<WH5850> of old men<WH2205>; and the glory<WH8597> of sons<WH1121> are their fathers<WH1>.
Excellent<WH3499> speech<WH8193> becomes<WH5000> not a fool<WH5036>: much less do lying<WH8267> lips<WH8193> a prince<WH5081>.
A gift<WH7810> is as a precious<WH2580> stone<WH68> in the eyes<WH5869> of him that has<WH1167> it<WH6437>: wherever it turns, it prospers<WH7919>.
He that covers<WH3680> a transgression<WH6588> seeks<WH1245> love<WH160>; but he that repeats<WH8138> a matter<WH1697> separates<WH6504> very friends<WH441>.
A reproof<WH1606> enters<WH5181> more into a wise man<WH995> than a hundred<WH3967> stripes<WH5221> into a fool<WH3684>.
A evil<WH7451> man seeks<WH1245> only rebellion<WH4805>: therefore a cruel<WH394> messenger<WH4397> shall be sent against him<WH7971>.
Let a bear<WH1677> robbed<WH7909> of her whelps meet<WH6298> a man<WH376>, rather than<WH408> a fool<WH3684> in his wickedness<WH200>.
Whoever rewards<WH7725> evil<WH7451> for good<WH2896>, evil<WH7451> shall not depart<WH4185> from his house<WH1004>.
The beginning<WH7225> of strife<WH4066> is as when one lets out<WH6362> water<WH4325>: therefore leave off<WH5203> contention<WH7379>, before<WH6440> it be meddled with<WH1566>.
He that justifies<WH6663> the wicked<WH7563>, and he that condemns<WH7561> the just<WH6662>, even they both<WH8147> are abomination<WH8441> to the Lord<WH3068>.
Therefore is there a price<WH4242> in the hand<WH3027> of a fool<WH3684> to get<WH7069> wisdom<WH2451>, seeing he has no heart to it<WH3820>?
A friend<WH7453> loves<WH157> at all times<WH6256>, and a brother<WH251> is born<WH3205> for adversity<WH6869>.
A man<WH120> void<WH2638> of understanding<WH3820> strikes<WH8628> hands<WH3709>, and becomes<WH6148> collateral<WH6161> in the presence<WH6440> of his friend<WH7453>.
He loves<WH157> transgression<WH6588> that loves<WH157> strife<WH4683>: and he that exalts<WH1361> his gate<WH6607> seeks<WH1245> destruction<WH7667>.
He that has a perverse<WH6141> heart<WH3820> finds<WH4672> no good<WH2896>: and he that has a perverse<WH2015> tongue<WH3956> falls<WH5307> into mischief<WH7451>.
He that fathers<WH3205> a fool<WH3684> does it to his sorrow<WH8424>: and the father<WH1> of a fool<WH5036> has no joy<WH8055>.
A merry<WH8056> heart<WH3820> does good<WH3190> like a medicine<WH1456>: but a broken<WH5218> spirit<WH7307> dries<WH3001> the bones<WH1634>.
A wicked<WH7563> man takes<WH3947> a gift<WH7810> out of the bosom<WH2436> to pervert<WH5186> the ways<WH734> of judgment<WH4941>.
Wisdom<WH2451> is before him that has understanding<WH6440>; but the eyes<WH5869> of a fool<WH3684> are in the ends<WH7097> of the earth<WH776>.
A foolish<WH3684> son<WH1121> is a grief<WH3708> to his father<WH1>, and bitterness<WH4470> to her that bore him<WH3205>.
Also to punish<WH6064> the just<WH6662> is not good<WH2896>, nor to strike<WH5221> princes<WH5081> for equity<WH3476>.
He that has<WH3045> knowledge<WH1847> spares<WH2820> his words<WH561>: and a man<WH376> of understanding<WH8394> is of a excellent<WH3368> spirit<WH7307>.
Even a fool<WH191>, when he holds his peace<WH2790>, is counted<WH2803> wise<WH2450>: and he that shuts<WH331> his lips<WH8193> is esteemed a man of understanding<WH995>.
